attributes.action: Google to pay tax based on its "profits from sales" in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Sales from UK customers were $6.5bn (£4.56bn), suggesting a profit of more than £1bn from those earnings. As Google UK paid corporate tax of £46.2m in the 18 months to June 2015, that would mean an effective tax rate of about 3 per cent.

rejection.details:
The Government can't apply the law just to one company. If you would like all international companies to pay tax on their UK sales, you could sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/116086
